android.car.occupantconnection

类 AbstractReceiverService

  • java.lang.Object
    • Service
      • android.car.occupantconnection.AbstractReceiverService

  • public abstract class AbstractReceiverService
extends Service
    A service used to respond to connection requests from peer clients on other occupant zones, receive Payload from peer clients, cache the received Payload, and dispatch it to the receiver endpoints in this client.

    The client app must extend this service to receive Payload from peer clients. When declaring this service in the manifest file, the client must add an intent filter with action "android.car.intent.action.RECEIVER_SERVICE" for this service, and require android.car.occupantconnection.permission.BIND_RECEIVER_SERVICE. For example: 

    
 <service android:name=".MyReceiverService"
          android:permission="android.car.occupantconnection.permission.BIND_RECEIVER_SERVICE"
          android:exported="true">
     <intent-filter>
         <action android:name="android.car.intent.action.RECEIVER_SERVICE" />
     </intent-filter>
 </service>

    This service runs on the main thread of the client app, and is a singleton for the client app. The lifecycle of this service is managed by car service (com.android.car.occupantconnection.CarOccupantConnectionService).

    This service can be bound by car service in two ways:

    • A sender endpoint in the peer client calls CarOccupantConnectionManager.requestConnection(android.car.CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo, java.util.concurrent.Executor, android.car.occupantconnection.CarOccupantConnectionManager.ConnectionRequestCallback) to connect to this client.
    • A receiver endpoint in this client calls CarOccupantConnectionManager.registerReceiver(java.lang.String, java.util.concurrent.Executor, android.car.occupantconnection.CarOccupantConnectionManager.PayloadCallback).

    Once all the senders have disconnected from this client and there is no receiver endpoints registered in this client, this service will be unbound by car service automatically.

    When this service is crashed, all connections to this client will be terminated. As a result, all senders that were connected to this client will be notified via CarOccupantConnectionManager.ConnectionRequestCallback.onDisconnected(android.car.CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo). In addition, the cached Payload will be lost, if any. The senders are responsible for resending the Payload if needed.

    • 构造器详细资料

      • AbstractReceiverService

        public AbstractReceiverService()

    • 方法详细资料

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate()

      • onBind

        public final IBinder onBind(Intent intent)

        To prevent the client app overriding this method improperly, this method is final. If the client app needs to bind to this service, it should override onLocalServiceBind(Intent).

      • onLocalServiceBind

        public IBinder onLocalServiceBind(Intent intent)
        Returns the communication channel to this service. If the client app needs to bind to this service and get a communication channel to this service, it should override this method instead of onBind(Intent).

      • onPayloadReceived

        public abstract void onPayloadReceived(CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo senderZone,
                                       Payload payload)
        Invoked when this service has received payload from its peer client on senderZone.

        The inheritance of this service should override this method to

        • forward the payload to the corresponding receiver endpoint(s), if any, and/or
        • cache the payload, then dispatch it when a new receiver endpoint is registered. The inheritance should clear the cache once it is no longer needed.

      • onReceiverRegistered

        public void onReceiverRegistered(java.lang.String receiverEndpointId)
        Invoked when a receiver endpoint is registered.

        The inheritance of this service can override this method to forward the cached Payload (if any) to the newly registered endpoint. The inheritance of this service doesn't need to override this method if it never caches the Payload.

        参数:
        receiverEndpointId - the ID of the newly registered endpoint

      • isSenderCompatible

        public boolean isSenderCompatible(long senderVersion)
        Returns whether the long version code (PackageInfo#getLongVersionCode) of the sender app is compatible with the receiver app's. If it doesn't match, this service will reject the connection request from the sender.

        The default implementation checks whether the version codes are identical. This is fine if all the peer clients run on the same Android instance, since PackageManager doesn't allow to install two different apps with the same package name - even for different users. However, if the peer clients run on different Android instances, and the app wants to support connection between them even if they have different versions, the app will need to override this method.

      • isSenderAuthorized

        public boolean isSenderAuthorized(SigningInfo senderSigningInfo)
        Returns whether the signing info (PackageInfo#signingInfo of the sender app is authorized. If it is not authorized, this service will reject the connection request from the sender.

        The default implementation simply returns true. This is fine if all the peer clients run on the same Android instance, since PackageManager doesn't allow to install two different apps with the same package name - even for different users. However, if the peer clients run on different Android instances, the app must override this method for security.

      • onConnectionInitiated

        public abstract void onConnectionInitiated(CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo senderZone)
        Invoked when the sender client in senderZone has requested a connection to this client.

        If user confirmation is needed to establish the connection, the inheritance can override this method to launch a permission activity, and call acceptConnection(android.car.CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo) or rejectConnection(android.car.CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo, int) based on the result. For driving safety, the permission activity must be distraction optimized. Alternatively, the permission can be granted during device setup.

      • onConnected

        public void onConnected(CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo senderZone)
        Invoked when the one-way connection has been established.

        In order to establish the connection, the inheritance of this service must call acceptConnection(android.car.CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo), and the sender must NOT call CarOccupantConnectionManager.cancelConnection(android.car.CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo) before the connection is established.

        Once the connection is established, the sender can send Payload to this client.

      • onConnectionCanceled

        public void onConnectionCanceled(CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo senderZone)
        Invoked when the sender has canceled the pending connection request, or has become unreachable after sending the connection request.

      • onDisconnected

        public void onDisconnected(CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo senderZone)
        Invoked when the connection is terminated. For example, the sender on senderZone has called CarOccupantConnectionManager.disconnect(android.car.CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo), or the sender has become unreachable.

        When disconnected, the sender can no longer send Payload to this client.

      • acceptConnection

        public final void acceptConnection(CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo senderZone)
        Accepts the connection request from senderZone.

      • rejectConnection

        public final void rejectConnection(CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo senderZone,
                                   int rejectionReason)
        Rejects the connection request from senderZone.
        参数:
        rejectionReason - the reason for rejection. It could be a predefined value ( CarOccupantConnectionManager.CONNECTION_ERROR_LONG_VERSION_NOT_MATCH, CarOccupantConnectionManager.CONNECTION_ERROR_SIGNATURE_NOT_MATCH, CarOccupantConnectionManager.CONNECTION_ERROR_USER_REJECTED), or app-defined value that is larger than CarOccupantConnectionManager.CONNECTION_ERROR_PREDEFINED_MAXIMUM_VALUE.

      • forwardPayload

        public final boolean forwardPayload(CarOccupantZoneManager.OccupantZoneInfo senderZone,
                                    java.lang.String receiverEndpointId,
                                    Payload payload)
        Forwards the payload to the given receiver endpoint in this client.

        Note: different receiver endpoints in the same client app are identified by their IDs, while different sender endpoints in the same client app are treated as the same sender. If the senders need to differentiate themselves, they can put the identity info into the payload it sends.

        参数:
        senderZone - the occupant zone that the Payload was sent from
        receiverEndpointId - the ID of the receiver endpoint
        payload - the Payload
        返回:
        whether the Payload has been forwarded to the receiver endpoint

      • getAllReceiverEndpoints

        public final java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllReceiverEndpoints()
        Returns an unmodifiable set containing all the IDs of the receiver endpoints. Returns an empty set if there is no receiver endpoint registered.

      • onStartCommand

        public int onStartCommand(Intent intent,
                          int flags,
                          int startId)

      • dump

        public void dump(java.io.FileDescriptor fd,
                 java.io.PrintWriter writer,
                 java.lang.String[] args)
